triples.name: Unmanned aerial vehicle
triples.relevance: The paper studies a real-world transfer of a controller from simulation to an octorotor UAV platform.

triples.name: Active disturbance rejection control
triples.relevance: The paper focuses on disturbance rejection in UAV control and analyzes how the controller counteracts disturbance forces.

triples.name: Reinforcement learning
triples.relevance: The controller being transferred from simulation to reality was developed using reinforcement learning.

triples.name: Control system
triples.relevance: The paper analyzes a feedback control system that manages the UAV's attitude and disturbance rejection.

triples.name: Jensen-Shannon divergence
triples.relevance: The paper uses Jensen-Shannon divergence to compare measurement distributions between simulated and real flights.

triples.name: Autoencoder
triples.relevance: A measurement autoencoder is applied and analyzed on real UAV flight data to understand measurement differences.

triples.name: Artificial neural network
triples.relevance: The paper uses neural networks for the measurement autoencoder and state transition model applied to flight data.

triples.name: State-space representation
triples.relevance: State transition models in the paper use state-space formulations to represent UAV dynamics and predict future states.

triples.name: Transfer learning
triples.relevance: The paper proposes and analyzes a methodology for quantifying sim-to-real transfer gaps when moving controllers from simulation to real-world UAV platforms.
